name: Everlasting Wreath for Good
description: We've been collecting materials from the garden and spiff-iying them into festive merriment! After all, doesn't everyone need a mini-wreath on the tree? Since there are enough to go around, we decided to have a benefit sale (tis the season) for our community garden. Why the garden? Well, the short of it is that we don't have a lockable shed and our tools keep walking away in the dark of night. The purchase of a mini wreath will buy us 2 studs to build a new shed and includes shipping. For $10 you get a mini wreath that is approximately 4 inches in diameter and a packet of seeds harvested from the garden (we'll find something else if you live in a state where we can't ship seeds), all packaged up beautifully in a repurposed box decorated by Mabel. Materials vary, but include: Grapevine or rosemary (your choice), silvery yarn, Knot and Bow gold twine, bells, chicken feathers, vintage buttons

name: Everlasting Snowman for Good
description: My 4 year old and I have been whipping up an army of snowmen. Some of these fellers (and gals, I suppose) are gifts for family, but we've had so much fun making them we have plenty to share! Since there are enough to go around, we decided to have a benefit sale (tis the season) for our community garden. Why the garden? Well, the short of it is that we don't have a lockable shed and our tools keep walking away in the dark of night. The purchase of a snowman will buy us 2 studs to build a new shed and includes shipping. For $10 you get a shiny, happy snowman (approximately 4 inches tall, party hat patterns vary) that will most assuredly twinkle on your tree! A packet of seeds harvested from the garden (we'll find something else if you live in a state where we can't ship seeds), packaged up beautifully in a repurposed box decorated by Mabel. Snowman ingredients: Air dry clay, glue, glitter, acrylic paint, paper, pipe cleaner, twigs from our yard, sparkly yarn, Knot and Bow cream/gold twine, a whole lotta love, and the magic of a 4 year old wrapped up in a whirlwind of creativity.

name: Ornaments from the Garden Workshop
description:
Let's get together and make festive ornaments from materials we gathered from the garden!  We'll have several different ornaments you can make, each ready for all levels of crafters; no experience necessary!

$8 covers your materials, snacks, and will buy 2 2x4s for a new shed at Little Sugar Creek Community Garden.  Pay online (credit card) or in person (cash).

December 14, 2013
Johnston Memorial Presbyterian Church
729 E 36th St, Charlotte, NC 28205

10 AM - noon

name: One at a time: Desert Scene
description: Print DetailsThis is an unframed 17" x 22" print (includes a 1/2" border around the image) on satin photo paper. The soft sheen of the paper enhances the sandy colors and textures of the image while providing an archival finish to your print. Each print is signed, dated, and numbered. Only 10 of this size will ever be printed. An 8 1/2 x 11" version in an edition of 20 is available through independent retailers that carry our work. * * * About our shop: Wolfie and the Sneak has a new shop format. We now offer 1 print at a time in very limited editions. The paper, the size and the time of availability will vary, but the goal is to have a new design every 2 months. Even if an edition doesn't sell out, it is pulled from the shop and will then be available only at craft shows. Why the new approach? It's a way to keep family and work in balance, maintain interest in content, stay outside that retail rush, and feel passionate about our products. * * * Shipping: US Customers: Your print ships wrapped in clear plastic inside a sturdy cardboard tube via USPS Priority Mail ($10) International Customers: Your print ships wrapped in clear plastic inside a sturdy cardboard tube via First Class mail ($20)
